intro: Draba lemmonii var. cyclomorpha, commonly known as the Lemmon's wintergreen, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces basal rosettes of narrow, linear leaves and has a short flowering period in early spring. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
